requirements.summary: Build a single-page public landing page at / with on-page navigation and required sections in English.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the deployed app root path (/) displays a landing page titled “CHILDSHIELD OUTREACH FOUNDATION”.
The page includes a top navigation (or equivalent) that scrolls to sections on the same page.
At minimum, the page contains these sections: Hero (name + short tagline), About, What We Do/Programs, Get Involved/Support, Contact.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the root app view that renders the single-page landing content at /, including a sticky header navigation that scrolls to in-page section anchors (Hero, About, Programs, Get Involved, Contact). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button, Card, Separator) to structure and style sections; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a small reusable section wrapper component to standardize spacing, max-width, headings, and anchor offsets for smooth in-page navigation; use shadcn-ui styling patterns where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a header component containing the logo, site name, and navigation links that scroll to the corresponding sections on the same page; use shadcn-ui Button (or similar) for nav actions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive child-focused charity visual theme (not blue/purple-primary) across typography, spacing, and components.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent theme is used across headings, body text, buttons/links, section backgrounds, and spacing.
Theme avoids a default/unstyled look and is applied consistently across all sections.
Theme does not rely on blue-and-purple as the primary palette.

file_operations.description: Add global styles and Tailwind base layers, including a warm, hopeful color system (e.g., amber/orange + green accents), typography defaults, and consistent section spacing; ensure the primary palette is not blue/purple.

Extend Tailwind theme tokens (as needed) to support the landing page look (e.g., warm accent colors, gradients, and typography/spacing defaults) while keeping a consistent, non-blue/purple primary palette across the app.

Apply the theme consistently across all landing sections (backgrounds, headings, buttons, cards) and use shadcn-ui components where appropriate for cohesive styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add basic SEO/share metadata (document title and meta description) for the landing page.
acceptanceCriteria: Browser tab title is set to “CHILDSHIELD OUTREACH FOUNDATION”.
A meta description is present and describes the charity in general terms without adding unverifiable specifics.

file_operations.description: Add a meta description for “CHILDSHIELD OUTREACH FOUNDATION” describing the charity in general, non-specific terms; ensure the existing document title remains “CHILDSHIELD OUTREACH FOUNDATION”.

requirements.summary: Include and render generated static logo and hero/banner images from frontend/public/assets/generated without backend serving.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The logo appears in the header/hero area, and the hero/banner image appears in the hero section.
No backend endpoints are introduced solely to serve these images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at the required path for static hosting.
Add the generated static hero/banner asset at the required path for static hosting.
Render the static logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/childshield-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header/hero area (static hosting; no backend involvement).
Render the hero/banner image from frontend/public/assets/generated/childshield-hero.dim_1600x600.png prominently in the Hero section, ensuring it loads via static hosting (no backend involvement).
